title: Dial-up becomes common
text: Most access is via dial-up from ISPs such as TE Data; internet cafés popularize public access.

title: Internet cafés & portals
text: Cafés spread in cities, local web portals and forums become daily destinations.

title: Early broadband pilots
text: ADSL pilot projects start appearing for households and small businesses.

title: Always-on connections
text: ADSL trials expand; ‘always-on’ access begins replacing per-minute dial-up for early adopters.

title: Free Internet Initiative expands
text: Connections billed as local phone calls help millions experience the web at lower cost.

title: E-learning & portals
text: Universities and training centers push e-learning websites; youth adoption rises.

title: ADSL goes mainstream
text: Lower entry prices and bundled modems bring ADSL to far more homes.

title: Social networks arrive
text: Early social media adoption grows; photo-sharing and messaging move online.

title: ADSL expansion & speed bumps
text: Wider coverage and higher entry speeds accelerate the shift away from dial-up.

title: USB modems & mobile data
text: Prepaid mobile broadband sticks offer flexible on-the-go access for laptops.

title: 3G era
text: Smartphones spread; mobile internet usage climbs with app stores and maps.

title: Social media surges
text: News, organizing, and live video shift to social platforms during major events.

title: E-commerce grows
text: Local marketplaces and online classifieds gain trust with cash-on-delivery.

title: Government services go online
text: More public-service portals launch for payments, information, and forms.

title: Backbone upgrades
text: National fiber backbone and international capacity projects improve latency and throughput.

title: 4G preparations
text: Spectrum refarming and trials prepare networks for LTE.

title: LTE licensing & rollout prep
text: Operators secure spectrum; device ecosystem for LTE matures quickly.

title: 4G LTE launch
text: Nationwide LTE services arrive; typical mobile speeds jump and video streaming takes off.

title: Fiber closer to homes
text: FTTx build-outs expand; higher-speed plans and converged bundles appear.

title: Cashless push & apps
text: Mobile wallets and ride-hailing/delivery super-apps grow daily, driven by better networks.

title: COVID-19 demand surge
text: Remote work, online classes, and video calls push record traffic; operators boost capacity.

title: Speed improvements
text: Average fixed and mobile speeds rise; more neighborhoods get fiber and better Wi-Fi gear.

title: Digital payments mainstream
text: E-payments, QR, and utility top-ups within super-apps become routine.

title: Cloud & data centers
text: New data-center capacity and cloud on-ramps reduce latency for local users and businesses.

title: FTTH coverage widens
text: More districts gain full-fiber options; base plans increase in speed and monthly caps.

title: Most Egyptians online
text: A majority of the population uses the internet regularly; networks prepare for next-gen services.
